description: Former President Trump posted on his Truth Social about shifting the next televised presidential debate a week earlier, with Fox hosting instead of ABC News.
title: Trump posts about a new debate plan, and Harris pushes back

description: The world record holder out-threw his opponents under a steady rain at Stade de France, becoming the first-ever shot-putter to win three Olympic gold medals.
title: In a league of his own, shot-putter Ryan Crouser wins U.S. 3rd Olympic gold in a row

description: Katie Ledecky has come through again winning her second gold medal in Paris in the women's 800-meter freestyle. The U.S. also won gold and a new world record in a relay race, edging out China.
title: Katie Ledecky wins 800m, her 9th Olympic gold, as U.S. swimmers bounce back in Paris

description: Scholars say Trump’s false claim that Harris “turned Black” isn't a new racial conspiracy theory.
title: Scholars on the 'divide and conquer' strategy behind Trump's false claim that Harris ‘turned Black’

description: Since its Olympic debut in 1996, St. Lucia has never won a medal of any kind. Sha'Carri Richardson, who had entered the Paris Games as the 100-meter favorite, finished in second to win silver.
title: Julien Alfred stuns Sha'Carri Richardson in 100m to win St. Lucia's 1st Olympic gold

description: The Trump assassination attempt and big Paris Olympics stars dominated the headlines in July. Here are some other stories that resonated with readers — but fell under the radar.
title: Reader's picks: 10 deeply engaged stories from July

description: Imane Khelif clinched a medal in an emotional fight that followed sharp scrutiny and online abuse as misconceptions about her gender have exploded into a larger clash about identity in sports.
title: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif clinches Olympic medal after gender outcry

description: Nedoroscik, the self-described dork who captured the nation's attention as he calmly awaited his turn in the Olympic men's gymnastics team final last week, won bronze in the pommel horse final on Saturday.
title: Stephen Nedoroscik, the 'Pommel Horse Guy' who charmed the Internet, wins bronze

description: This week, Wait Wait is live at Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts with special guest Dr. Anthony Fauci and panelists Negin Farsad, Karen Chee, and Tom Papa
title: 'Wait Wait' for August 3, 2024: Live at Wolf Trap with Dr. Fauci

description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin ordered fighter jets as well as Navy destroyers and cruisers deployed to "bolster force protection for U.S. troops in the region and to defend Israel," the Pentagon said.
title: U.S. deploys ships and fighter jets to Middle East as Israel braces for Iran attack

description: Tensions increase in the Middle East, as Israel expects an attack from Iran and its allies. Israel says it's killed several top commanders of Hamas, Hezbollah, and Islamic Jihad.
title: The U.S. is sending more warships to the Middle East as Israel steps up attacks

description: Nigerians in several major cities are protesting government economic policies that are causing inflation and hunger.
title: Thousands take to the streets in Nigerian cities to protest government policies

description: NPR's Scott Simon and ESPN's Michelle Steele discuss the record breaking performances of the first week of the Olympics in Paris and look forward to the next week.
title: Saturday Sports: A record-breaking week at the Olympics

description: Until this year, women were not allowed to fully participate in a large religious festival in New Bedford, Mass. Then they threatened to sue.
title: Women are taking part in a century-old Catholic festival for the first time

description: Some lucky sports fans are in Paris, but most Olympics viewers are watching from home. NPR Pop Culture Critic Linda Holmes gives host Scott Simon her review of the broadcast coverage so far.
title: A roundup of the Olympics on TV so far

description: Russian forces are making small but steady gains in eastern Ukraine and seem to be targeting a key town. Ukraine is getting more Western weapons, but Russia still has more firepower and more troops.
title: Russian troops are gaining ground in eastern Ukraine

description: Amtrak is on its way to carrying more passengers this fiscal year than ever before. NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Reuters reporter David Shepardson about why that is.
title: Amtrak is set to carry more passengers than ever before this year

description: With the Democratic National Convention returning to Chicago this month, media historian Michael Socolow warns against drawing parallels between 1968 and now. He talks with NPR's Scott Simon.
title: In 1968, the DNC was also held in Chicago. That's where the similarities end

description: NPR's Scott Simon talks to Rich Thau, who studies swing states, about some key voters this election: those who supported former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley in primaries, and "double disapprovers."
title: How Harris entering the presidential race will impact those who were on the fence

description: The stock market tumbled Friday after a weaker-than-expected jobs report. Together with a gloomy factory survey, the news has investors worried about a broader economic slowdown.
title: Stocks fell after weak jobs report. Are we heading for a recession?

description: Harris started her political career in the Bay Area. And since launching her campaign, donations from Silicon Valley have poured in. But that doesn’t necessarily mean she’ll go easy on Big Tech.
title: Tech luminaries and VCs go all-in on Kamala Harris campaign, 5 things to know

description: The new law would require tech companies to limit children's exposure to dangerous online content. The last time Congress legislated on kids online safety was before social media and smartphones.
title: A historic new law would protect kids online and hold tech companies accountable

description: Polls had shown President Biden lagging his 2020 levels with Latino voters. Now Biden is out, and Vice President Harris offers Democrats an opportunity to rally Latinos back to their side.
title: Latino support for Biden was lagging. Harris gives Democrats a chance to win some back

description: Great white shark tours have become popular around Cape Cod as more of the largest predator fish are showing up.
title: Pricey great white shark tours take off in Cape Cod

description: The parties in lawsuits seeking damages for last year's Maui wildfires have reached a $4 billion global settlement, a court filing said Friday.
title: Parties in lawsuits seeking damages for Maui fires reach $4B global settlement

description: The previous agreements exchanged guilty pleas from the men for sentences of at most, life in prison.
title: Defense secretary revokes plea deal with accused 9/11 plotters
